Introduction

Hwang Hyunjin is a South Korean rapper, dancer, singer-songwriter, and composer under JYP Entertainment. He is a member of Stray Kids and part of its unofficial subunit Danceracha.

Hyunjin was scouted by JYP Entertainment while shopping with his mother in middle school. With no prior experience, he trained for two years before joining the survival show Stray Kids in 2017. He officially debuted with the group on March 25, 2018, with the album I Am Not and the title track "District 9."

In 2021, he took a four-month hiatus following school bullying allegations.

Hyunjin was named one of Forbes Korea’s "Top 30 Under 30," ranking among the top five entertainers and the youngest honoree in 2023. The same year, he became Versace’s first South Korean and Asian male ambassador, later starring in the brand’s Holiday Campaign and attending global fashion events. He was also appointed a brand ambassador for Cartier on September 24, 2024, and confirmed as Givenchy Beauty’s ambassador on March 5, 2025.
